title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be cut to save $16.8 million; faces legal challenges affecting his future with the Patriots.
Christian Barmore, facing court proceedings, might be traded to balance cap if a premier edge rusher joins the Patriots.
Garrett Bradbury might be cut during training camp, potentially saving over $5 million if Jared Wilson wins the center job.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not return for the Celtics' Sunday game against the 76ers due to a right Achilles tendon injury.
Philadelphia's Joel Embiid is out for Sunday's game with an oblique strain, expected to miss the next three games.
The Celtics have won eight of their last ten games and will conclude the regular-season series with the 76ers on Sunday.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs against the Twins, totaling three homers in the first week of spring training.
Duran's recent success against left-handed pitching contrasts with his .232 career average and .620 OPS against lefties.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora praises Duran's early performance, indicating potential changes in the team's lineup strategy.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored 39 goals for Boston College this season.
Boston University defeated Boston College 3-1 in their 301st meeting, featuring Bruins prospects from both teams.
James Hagens leads with 39 points; Dean Letourneau has emerged with 34 points as a top performer for BC.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed NBA assistant coach considers the Boston Celtics favorites to win the Eastern Conference despite trailing the Pistons.
The Celtics rank second in offensive rating with a 39-20 record, showing strong performance since Thanksgiving.
Jaylen Brown leads the Celtics in scoring, while potential reintegration of Jayson Tatum could enhance their roster.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on Feb. 27.
The setlist featured a mix of new tracks and classics, including Drive-By Truckers covers and a Rolling Stones cover.
Isbell showcased his range with genres including Americana, Southern rock, country, and folk throughout the concert.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers Maxx Crosby, Trey Hendrickson, or Jaelan Phillips this offseason.
Raiders not rushing to trade Maxx Crosby; he might stay in Vegas until NFL Draft week.
Draft prospects like Zion Young offer potential options for Patriots to bolster pass rush.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance's $110 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery may integrate CBS with TNT/TBS for sports broadcasting.
The deal may enhance CBS's coverage of MLB and NHL and expand college football broadcasts.
Netflix may seek NFL broadcast rights after missing out on acquiring Warner Bros. Discovery.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are interested in acquiring A.J. Brown, but find the Eagles' asking price of a first and second-round pick too high.
If traded before June 1, A.J. Brown's move would cost the Eagles nearly $44 million in dead money.
Patriots may keep Stefon Diggs and restructure his contract to accommodate Brown's potential acquisition.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts will replace E-ZPass transponders with RFID sticker tags starting Sunday to save costs.
The new windshield sticker tags are free for E-ZPass users and activate when passing toll gantries.
The sticker tags cost 55 cents each, compared to $6.70 for transponders, saving an estimated $7.4 million annually.
